TV MANUFACTURERS EXHIBIT AT NAEB CONVENTION
Exhibits and demonstrations of new TV equipment will be a major attraction
tomorrow when the annual convention of the National Association of Educational Broad¬
casters opens. Members of the NAEB will convene at the Sheraton-Cadillac Hotel,
Detroit. ’ '
V3
Among the exhibitors will be Adler Electronics, who will show their translator,
100-watt amplifier, 100-watt UHF transmitter, and 2 KM3 microwave equipment. Century
Lighting and Dage Television will cooperate in an exhibit involving TV lighting
equipment, a TV mobile control room, and the new 320-B air vidicon camera* Argus
will introduce their special §595 TV camera specially designed for use in classroom
demonstrations. RCA will exhibit classroom television receivers; nnd 3M, audiotape
and videotape. Ampex will demonstrate the imported Marconi camera and the videotape
recorder.
